'Phosphogypsum' refers to the gypsum formed as a by-product of processing
phosphate ore into fertilizer with sulfuric acid.

Phosphogypsum is produced from the fabrication of phosphoric acid by reacting
phosphate ore (apatite) with sulfuric acid according to the following reaction:

:Ca 5(PO 4) 3X + 5 H 2SO 4 +
10 H 2O â 3 H 3PO 4 + 5 CaSO 4 Â· 2
H 2O + HX

:where X may include OH, F, Cl, or Br

Phosphogypsum is radioactive due to the presence of naturally occurring uranium
and radium in the phosphate ore.

Marine-deposited phosphate typically has a higher level of radioactivity than
igneous phosphate deposits, because uranium is present in seawater. Health Physics Society.
